data.title: Students – Ada Scotland Festival
data.text:
Category: Students

CSSMeet – Teaching to Inspire Gender Balance

Join us for an exciting online event focused on promoting diversity in computer science education! This meetup is designed for all teachers delivering Computing Science including probationers, primary teachers and PGDE students.

ONLINE

19:00 Wednesday 25 October 2023

Continue reading CSSMeet – Teaching to Inspire Gender Balance

Barclays presents: Think Like a Fintech & Early Careers Panel

Making the leap from education to tech career? Young tech pro’s share their insights followed by Think Like a FinTech – an instructor-led, user-centred design workshop.

IN-PERSON

13:00 Wednesday 4 October

Continue reading Barclays presents: Think Like a Fintech & Early Careers Panel

Napier STEM presents: Women and gender minorities in STEM careers event

ome along to our careers event for students studying Computing and Engineering degrees. This is a great opportunity to gain insight into industry, along with a chance meet other women and gender minorities in STEM. We will also be providing free ice cream!

IN-PERSON

14:00 Wednesday 11 October 2023

Continue reading Napier STEM presents: Women and gender minorities in STEM careers event

Equate Scotland presents: Journeys into Data Science

Join Equate Scotlands’ webinar to hear about opportunities for women coming to a career in data science later in life with talks from Gule Saman and Carla Chiodi

ONLINE

12:30 to 13:30 Thursday 5 October 2023 Continue reading Equate Scotland presents: Journeys into Data Science

ENUSEC presents: Capture the Flag Competition

Develop and challenge your cyber skills in ENUSEC’s (Edinburgh Napier Security Society) Capture the Flag cybersecurity competition, with challenges based on cryptography, open-source intelligence and more!

ONLINE

2 to 13 October 2023 Continue reading ENUSEC presents: Capture the Flag Competition

BBC Scotland Presents: Exploring Tech Careers in Media

Are you keen to learn more about the STEM career opportunities available at BBC Scotland? Do you want to widen and strengthen your professional networks? If so then this is the event for you.

IN-PERSON

14:30 Thursday 5 October 2023

Continue reading BBC Scotland Presents: Exploring Tech Careers in Media

Morgan Stanley presents: Live Podcast Recording with Tandy Nicole

Tandy Nicole is the award-winning founder of Womennetic, a grassroots community organisation committed to creating channels for marginalized women, particularly asylum seekers and refugees, to get into tech.

IN-PERSON

18:30 Friday 13 October 2023

Continue reading Morgan Stanley presents: Live Podcast Recording with Tandy Nicole

Morgan Stanley presents: Cyber Heist – Unleash Your Inner Hacker

Whether you’re a tech enthusiast or a curious mind, our Cyber Heist Event will provide you with a unique opportunity to learn from industry experts and gain insights into the world of cybersecurity.

IN-PERSON

17:00 Monday 2 October 2023

Continue reading Morgan Stanley presents: Cyber Heist – Unleash Your Inner Hacker

Barclays presents: Evening Industry Panel Event

Led by females in a variety of tech roles, this event explores how tech is embedded across multiple industries and the opportunities this affords women.

IN-PERSON

17:30 Wednesday 11 October 2023

Continue reading Barclays presents: Evening Industry Panel Event

AutoRek presents – Trihackathon for Job Changers and Higher Ed Students

Held in the super cool Garment Factory offices, AutoRek are hosting a Trihackathon for job changers , those in further or higher education, and anyone looking for a route into tech roles.

IN-PERSON

18:00 Friday 13 October 2023

Continue reading AutoRek presents – Trihackathon for Job Changers and Higher Ed Students

Ada Scotland Inspiring Teacher Award 2023

Update: The results are in! The teachers nominated for this year’s award were as follows: And the winner is… Fiona Sabba from Barrhead High School! A hamper and trophy will be making their way to Fiona shortly… Do you know a teacher in Scotland who has gone the extra mile to encourage girls to get into computing? Perhaps someone who’s inspired their female pupils in class, run a coding club for girls, or simply had some extra words of encouragement for a female pupil with an interest in computers? Nominate your inspiring teacher using the form below or click here! … Continue reading Ada Scotland Inspiring Teacher Award 2023

Lassie STEM Ambassador Resource Pack

The Lassie STEM Ambassador team have developed this excellent resource pack for engaging with role models and industry in lessons and activities. Continue reading Lassie STEM Ambassador Resource Pack

Me, Myself & AI Schools Competition from the Scottish AI Alliance

The Scottish AI Alliance invite all classes in Scotland to take part in their schools competition: Me, Myself & AI. Continue reading Me, Myself & AI Schools Competition from the Scottish AI Alliance

Heart of Midlothian FC Innovation Centre Clubs

Two free clubs for school ages S1-3. Upgrade your tech skills: Design a game or code with a micro:bit Continue reading Heart of Midlothian FC Innovation Centre Clubs

First Steps in Tech at the BBC

Applications for our latest round of opportunities launches in November and BBC Scotland, in partnership with the Ada Scot Festival, are holding an in person event to explore what a career in tech is like in a global media organisation.

10:00 Thursday 27 October

Continue reading First Steps in Tech at the BBC

Capture the Flag

Develop and challenge your cyber skills in ENUSEC’s (Edinburgh Napier Security Society) Capture the Flag cybersecurity competition, with challenges based on cryptography, open-source intelligence and more! Continue reading Capture the Flag

Dundee University presents: Ada Lovelace inspired App Design Competition

Explore the achievements of women in STEM throughout history and design an Augmented reality app to showcase these in an engaging way. Amazon vouchers for top three winners.

Continue reading Dundee University presents: Ada Lovelace inspired App Design Competition

Barclays Code Playground II – Coding Basics with VEXcode

A virtual coding session, open to anyone who would like to learn the basics with VEXcode, led by Barclays Eagles.

12:00 Monday 24 October 2022

Continue reading Barclays Code Playground II – Coding Basics with VEXcode

Barclays Code Playground – Coding Basics with VEXcode

A virtual coding session, open to anyone who would like to learn the basics with VEXcode, led by Barclays Eagles.

12:00 Tuesday 18 October 2022

Continue reading Barclays Code Playground – Coding Basics with VEXcode

Live Podcast Recording: An Audience with Toni Scullion

Join us as we record our Women in Tech podcast live with award-winning gender diversity advocate, dressCode charity founder & Ada Lovelace Festival co-founder Toni Scullion, with time for Q&A and networking.

18:30 Thursday 20 October 2022

Continue reading Live Podcast Recording: An Audience with Toni Scullion

No Girls Allowed

Elina Karadzhova, Motion Designer & Editor, Dentsu Creative chats with Helena Good, DayDreamBelievers, sharing the challenges and opportunities on her journey to her super cool role at a global creative agency. This is followed by a video tutorial on https://spline.design/. Continue reading No Girls Allowed

Myth Busting

Is tech just for “nerds”? Do I have to know how to code? Will I be the only woman on my course? Join some of the wonderful women from tech company Forrit, as they separate the myths from the facts about working in tech. Continue reading Myth Busting

Barclays presents: Am I too technical to be promoted?

Barclays Women in Technology network are delighted to host a panel event to discuss the careers of senior female technologists. Our panel members are all senior colleagues in the business and will include roles such as software developers and product owners, amongst others.

11:00 Tuesday 25 October 2022

Continue reading Barclays presents: Am I too technical to be promoted?

Barclays presents: First Steps in Tech – How to Take the Right Career Path part II

Are you curious about launching a rewarding career full of impact, doing work that both inspires and challenges you? This panel will explore the early stages of a career in technology.

14:00 Wednesday 26 October 2022 Continue reading Barclays presents: First Steps in Tech – How to Take the Right Career Path part II

Barclays presents: First Steps in Tech – How to Take the Right Career Path

Are you curious about launching a rewarding career full of impact, doing work that both inspires and challenges you? This panel will explore the early stages of a career in technology.

14:00 Wednesday 19 October 2022

Continue reading Barclays presents: First Steps in Tech – How to Take the Right Career Path

Barclays presents: Let’s Chat… with Sarah Rashid

To kick off Barclays virtual events at the Ada Scotland Festival 2022, Barclays Women in Technology network are hosting an informal chat with one of our senior leaders in Glasgow.

11:00 Thursday 13 October 2022

Continue reading Barclays presents: Let’s Chat… with Sarah Rashid

Making Work Work for You

This workshop provides tips on how to progress your career and overcome some of the barriers women face in the tech industry

12:30 Wednesday 19 October 2022

Continue reading Making Work Work for You

Scottish AI Playbook Editathon with DataFest Fringe and ada.scot

Want to get involved with developing the Scottish AI Playbook wiki while learning new skills in wiki editing? Then the Scottish AI Playbook Editathon is for you!

10:00 Friday 28 October 2022

Continue reading Scottish AI Playbook Editathon with DataFest Fringe and ada.scot

dressCode Halloween Coding Competition

Open now! The DressCode/J.P.Morgan Halloween Coding Competition for all primary and secondary schools. Code a Halloween themed project that includes a skeleton. Closing date 3 November Continue reading dressCode Halloween Coding Competition

Scottish Government Digital, Data & Technology (DDaT) workshop

An interactive workshop exploring the Digital, Data and Technology roles in the Scottish Government and the important work they carry out.

14:00 Monday 17 October 2022

14:00 Tuesday 25 October 2022

Continue reading Scottish Government Digital, Data & Technology (DDaT) workshop

Online Workshop: Running Effective Gender Balance Activities

This workshop will share tested and easy to use techniques to improve the efficacy of gender balance projects.

15:00 Wednesday 19th October 2022 Continue reading Online Workshop: Running Effective Gender Balance Activities

dressCode’s Hopper Awards

The aim of this award is to provide a specific opportunity for female pupils to achieve success in Computing Science in their school. This award is supported by JPMorgan, we hope that this also raises awareness to parents and guardians that Computing Science is an important subject. There is one FREE award available for every secondary school in Scotland. The name of our award is “The Hopper Award for Excellence in Computing Science” named in honour of Grace Hopper, a pioneer of computer programming. Find out more and apply for your Award Continue reading dressCode’s Hopper Awards

dressCode’s Role Model Poster

Celebrate computing talent by taking part in the dressCode Role Model Poster programme. It is quick and easy to nominate. Continue reading dressCode’s Role Model Poster

Leidos presents: No Wrong Path to Tech

Join our interactive virtual panel event to hear from four amazing women whose careers started off very differently.

10:30 Wednesday 26th October 2022

Continue reading Leidos presents: No Wrong Path to Tech

Using Game Design to Provoke Cybersecurity Discussion

In this video Daisy and Olga share how they designed two games to provoke discussion about cybersecurity. This is a great resource for anyone interested in game design and coding Continue reading Using Game Design to Provoke Cybersecurity Discussion

Get Linked-In-To-Cyber

Looking to build your cyber career but don’t know where to start? Hear from three experts how to leverage your Linkedin profile to get noticed.

13:00 Wednesday 12th October 2022 Continue reading Get Linked-In-To-Cyber

An Introduction to Sensor Technology

A short online talk, including live interactive demos, exploring the important role of sensor devices in everyday life.

16:30 Tuesday 18th October 2022 Continue reading An Introduction to Sensor Technology

Ada Scotland Inspiring Teacher Award 2022

Do you know a teacher in Scotland who has gone the extra mile to encourage girls to get into computing?

Perhaps someone who’s inspired their female pupils in class, run a coding club for girls, or simply had some extra words of encouragement for a female pupil with an interest in computers?

If so, please nominate them for the Ada Scotland Inspiring Teacher Award 2022! Continue reading Ada Scotland Inspiring Teacher Award 2022

Ada Scotland Festival Launch Event 2022

Join us for the launch of the Ada Scotland Festival 2022, hosted by our Headline Sponsor, Barclays!

14:00 Wednesday 12 October 2022 Continue reading Ada Scotland Festival Launch Event 2022

What’s it really like to study tech at uni?

Ever thought about studying tech at uni? Now’s your chance to ask questions of three students already studying computing, software engineering and ethical hacking.

LIVE: 21 October at 1pm Continue reading What’s it really like to study tech at uni?

The Wonderful World of IT

In this video from Head Resourcing, Rachel Ricketts discusses the wonderful world of IT, where she highlights the various options open to individuals to enter the world of IT, including college courses, university, apprenticeships. The vast array of roles within … Continue reading The Wonderful World of IT

Ada Scotland Inspiring Teacher Award 2021

Update: The nominations are in! The shortlist of nominated teachers is as follows… Jacqueline Campbell – Linlithgow Academy Graeme Colley – Arbroath Academy Ms Craig – St. Thomas Aquinas RC Secondary School Mr Gibson – Shawlands Academy Fraser Christie – St Paul’s RC Academy Maggie Tuohy – Douglas Academy Mrs Mitchell – Mearns Primary School And the winner of the Ada Scotland Inspiring Teacher Award 2021 is… Jacqueline Campbell at Linlithgow Academy Congratulations Ms Campbell! A hamper of ethically-sourced goodies is on its way to you now, courtesy of our sponsors, VeryConnect, Morgan Stanley, and Autorek. Here’s a flavour of … Continue reading Ada Scotland Inspiring Teacher Award 2021

Poster Competition

We are excited to launch our poster competition in association with dressCode and Barclays. The competition Pupils have to design their own Choose Computing Science poster. You can submit entries to via the Google form here: bit.ly/AdaScotPoster2021 Important to … Continue reading Poster Competition

Automated Testing

By GU Switch – Glasgow University Learn about automated testing with Lucia Cangarova of Glasgow University. In this short video, Lucy will introduce you to Cypress, a framework for testing. Continue reading Automated Testing

Imposter Syndrome

Have you ever felt as though you’re a bit of a fraud – as though you achieved what you did through luck, not merit? This is imposter syndrome. It’s not just you. Even the most successful women have admitted to … Continue reading Imposter Syndrome

Building Confidence in Students

Discover the importance of reaching your goals. In the session we will discuss how to build your confidence in order to pursue a career in STEM.

LIVE: 20 October at 2.30pm Continue reading Building Confidence in Students

There is No Wrong Path to Technology

Discover how two women changed their career path. Hear their journey as they talk you through their steps to change.

LIVE: 19 October at 4pm Continue reading There is No Wrong Path to Technology

Barclays: First Steps in Tech – How to Take the Right Career Path

Discover what an early career in technology is all about with the team at Barclays.

LIVE: 11 October 2021 at 5pm Continue reading Barclays: First Steps in Tech – How to Take the Right Career Path

Barclays: How We Switched to A Tech Career

Join the team at Barclays in this panel event where they will be discussing different journeys into the world of technology.

LIVE: 18 October at 5pm Continue reading Barclays: How We Switched to A Tech Career

Equate Meetup: Ada Lovelace Day

Join Equate Scotland’s meetup and hear from inspirational women share their stories into the world of tech.

LIVE: 13 October at 5.30pm Continue reading Equate Meetup: Ada Lovelace Day

How to Start Coding

How to start coding with Code First Girls. In this session we’ll introduce you to arrange of free classes and courses to get you started.

LIVE: 13 October at 5pm Continue reading How to Start Coding

Digital Futures – Dell Technologies

Discover how technology impacts every part of our lives. In this session Dell Technologies will talk you through the many different careers available in technology.

LIVE: 21 October at 11am Continue reading Digital Futures – Dell Technologies

Data Skills Live: Defend The Rhino 🦏

We need you to help save the Rhino. Challenge your students to help save these beautiful animals using their technical skills. No exp. required.

LIVE: 20 October at 10am Continue reading Data Skills Live: Defend The Rhino 🦏

Tech Tuesdays by Tech We Can

Suitable for students 8-14 There’s more to a Tech Tuesday session than taking a ‘well, I never knew that!’ look at the tech we use every day. Each 20-45 minute session, led by a Tech We Can teacher, is a fun, informative way to get 8-14 year olds excited about the possibilities of tech. It’s a chance to get hands on, with a challenge after each session. And it’s a chance to explore exciting career paths that most will be discovering for the first time. From AI and augmented reality to Co-Bots and even tech for the environment, there’s a … Continue reading Tech Tuesdays by Tech We Can

Tech Women Talk Opportunities

Join our panel of inspirational young women who together will share their unexpected journeys into the world of tech.

LIVE: 20 October at 5pm Continue reading Tech Women Talk Opportunities

My Story – Mahum Khan (Women in Games Ambassador)

Career journey, highs and lows, and what she’s learned along the way. There will be an opportunity for questions at the end.

LIVE: 14 October at 2-3pm. Continue reading My Story – Mahum Khan (Women in Games Ambassador)

Inspire Me: Want to be a Game Designer?

Get a taste of what it’s like to be a Game Designer. Using Microsoft MakeCode you’ll get hands on experience creating your very own video game.

LIVE: 12 October 2021 at 10am Continue reading Inspire Me: Want to be a Game Designer?

Inspire Me: Exploring the world of Data and AI

Explore the world of AI with The Data Lab Innovation Centre.

LIVE: 18 October at 4pm Continue reading Inspire Me: Exploring the world of Data and AI

Show Me: Code Art

Get creative, learning how to develop and create all kinds of shapes and designs. Hands on session ideal for anyone who enjoys designing new concepts.

LIVE: 19 October at 10am Continue reading Show Me: Code Art
